archdesc.scopecontent: "It began as a native American foot trail. It later became a military road connecting Fort Detroit to Fort Dearborn in Chicago. It was traveled by explorers, missionaries and fur trappers, and once was the primary route for those heading west for new land. ... This is the story of the evolution of transportation in Michigan along a narrow pathway from Detroit to Chicago. This is a journey down the Old Chicago Road."--Container.
